Text saved: An asteroid is a small rock that travels around the Sun in space. NASA is now working toward logging some of the smaller asteroids, those that measure 140 metres across or more, because these objects could be harmful. Scientists think there are 25,000 asteroids of this size, but so far they have logged only about 8,000 and the other 17,000 remain unaccounted for. When a 19-metre asteroid exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013, it injured 1,200 people. This shows that medium asteroids could pose a great risk if they come into Earth’s orbit.
